content:
GF#15977 says:

We will expose "best practice recommendations" with a specific extension on invariant (after extending the spreadsheet tooling to support this) and will encourage work groups to expose existing best practices using this mechanism, including those noted in the comments here. Best practices will be marked as "informative".

I'm coming to implement, and running into an information gap in this disposition. It's an invariant... so it should be a warning? a hint? is the invariant informative, or the fact that it's best practice? should it be published on a different page?
@Lloyd McKenzie / @Jeffrey Danford chair and mover (I was only seconder :grin: )

Best practices themselves would be informative. They ought to be rendered in a separate section and noted as informative, but they don't necessarily need to be on a separate page. I'd say that best practices would need to be hints.
